member.name: M:ArtCom.Logging.Log.WriteDebug(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a debug message for development-only purposes.

member.name: M:ArtCom.Logging.Log.WriteWarning(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a log warning that indicates something might be wrong.

member.name: M:ArtCom.Logging.Log.WriteError(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a log error that indicates a recoverable failure.

member.name: M:ArtCom.Logging.Log.WriteFatal(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a fatal log error that indicates a non-recoverable failure.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogFormat.TimeStampFormatISO8601
member.summary: DateTime format specifier using the ISO 8601 date/time format.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogFormat.TimeStampFormatDefault
member.summary: The DateTime format specifier that is used as long as nothing else is specified.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogFormat.FrameStampFormatDefault
member.summary: The frame stamp format specifier that is used as long as nothing else is specified.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogMessageType.Debug
member.summary: A debug-only message that should be absent in non-development builds.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogMessageType.Warning
member.summary: A warning indicates that something might be wrong, though the application can potentially continue to function as intended.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogMessageType.Error
member.summary: An error indicates a recoverable failure that may, however, lead to limited program functionality or undefined behavior.

member.name: F:ArtCom.Logging.LogMessageType.Fatal
member.summary: A fatal error indicates a non-recoverable failure that will likely cause the application to crash or reach a state where no meaningful operation is possible.

member.name: M:ArtCom.Logging.Logs.InitGlobalLogFile(System.String,System.String,ArtCom.Logging.TextLogOutputConfig)
member.summary: Initializes a global logfile using the specified target directory and file name using default settings. If not specified otherwise, a Logs directory is used and the log file's name is derived from the current .
